definition: horizontal rectangular inscribed tablet hung over a door or on a wall/shallow round woven bamboo basket
"right open box" radical (Kangxi radical 22), occurring in 区, 医, 匹 etc
flat/(coll.) to beat (sb) up/old variant of 匾[bian3]

sentences.english: He carelessly knocked over the silkworm tray, leaving the floor covered with folia mori.
sentences.chinese: 他一不小心打翻了蚕匾，桑叶散满了一地。

sentences.english: Chapter three, Shakespeare, or a plaque on both his houses.
sentences.chinese: 第三章，莎士比亚，或两个家的纪念匾。

sentences.english: The following are floor plaques are Liang Fang plenum .
sentences.chinese: 正匾以下均以梁枋隔层。

sentences.english: This is the Nine Dragon Plaque presented by Emperor Yongzheng.
sentences.chinese: 这是雍正皇帝御赐的九龙匾。

sentences.english: Therefore, the Nine Dragon Plaque is also one of the three treasures.
sentences.chinese: 所以嘛，这九龙匾也是陈宅的三宝之一。

sentences.english: Even these two plaques look worn and old.
sentences.chinese: 你看连这里的两块匾都是残的。

sentences.english: Getting a plaque like this from an emperor was not easy then.
sentences.chinese: 能得到皇帝赐的这块匾太不容易了。

sentences.english: After he had finished speech, the French President was given an inscribed commemorative plaque from Peking University.
sentences.chinese: 演讲结束后，赠予了法国总统北京大学题字留念匾。

definition: variant of 匾額|匾额[bian3 e2]
area above the lintel of a doorway
couplet (hung on each side of the door frame)
rhyming couplet/pair of lines of verse written vertically down the sides of a doorway/CL:副[fu4],幅[fu2]
a screen wall across the gate of a house (for privacy)
couplet (hung on the columns of a hall)
